post_text: April 30, 2019 at 7:39 PM#1Hey all, been staring at this for a bit and need some extra eyes... I'm trying to change various bits of an effect line via macro, with this syntax:Syntax: Assign Effect $FXCurrentTemplate /groups = $GroupsFXLess Variables: Assign Effect 397 thru 417 /groups = 1Now, that does change the groups like it should, but it also starts the effects with any fixtures selected, which I don't want. The issue is that I'm wanting the macro to change a handful of template effects, but in practice I am likely running ONE of those effects and using this macro to change the line, which also starts the other effects.I just need a way to not start the effect(s) when I change a line within those effects. Feels like I'm missing something dumb... Any thoughts? Thanks in advance!

posts.post_text: May 27, 2019 at 8:33 PM#2Hi KnissoneI can reproduce the problem but only when i have fixtures selected, the selection will then start running only one effect within the effect selection when using your syntax, when there is no fixture selection the effect won't start.A work around for now could be to use BlindEdit:BlindEdit OnAssign Effect $FXCurrentTemplate /groups = $GroupsFXBlindEdit Off
